metadata.feature_description: Manages placement and movement of modules within content layout columns/panes.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add module to content layout pane

steps.action: Navigated to page Edit Mode and identified Content Layout panes
steps.expected: Content Layout panes should be visible with option to add modules
steps.actual: Content Layout panes (F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2, 9977_Pane1-4) visible with 'Add Existing Module' links in each pane

steps.action: Verified 'Add Existing Module' link presence in each pane
steps.expected: Each pane should have an option to add modules
steps.actual: All panes have 'Add Existing Module' links allowing users to add content to panes

steps.action: Located module in F30A_Pane1 and accessed Move menu
steps.expected: Move menu should display with target pane options
steps.actual: Move menu displayed with options: Top, Up, Down, Bottom, To F30A_Pane1, To F30A_Pane2, To Another Page

steps.action: Selected 'To F30A_Pane2' to move TABLETS module
steps.expected: Module should be moved to F30A_Pane2
steps.actual: Module successfully moved to F30A_Pane2, page refreshed showing module in new location

steps.action: Verified module appears in target pane
steps.expected: TABLETS module should appear in F30A_Pane2
steps.actual: TABLETS module confirmed in F30A_Pane2 alongside WEARABLES and TELEVISIONS modules

steps.action: Accessed Admin menu for a module in content layout pane
steps.actual: Admin menu displayed with Settings, Export Content, Import Content, Help, Develop, Delete, and Refresh options

steps.expected: Delete option should be clickable to remove module from pane
steps.actual: Delete option confirmed available in Admin menu, allowing module removal from pane

steps.action: Accessed Move menu and selected 'Up' option to reorder module
steps.expected: Module should move up in the display order within the pane
steps.actual: Module successfully reordered using Up option, position changed within F30A_Pane2

steps.action: Verified new module order in pane
steps.expected: Module order should be preserved after reordering
steps.actual: New module order confirmed - TABLETS module moved up in the display order as expected

steps.action: Observed empty pane areas in Edit Mode
steps.expected: Empty panes should be visible and allow content to be added
steps.actual: Empty pane areas visible with dashed borders in Edit Mode, clearly indicating drop zones

steps.action: Verified 'Add Existing Module' link in empty pane areas
steps.expected: Users should be able to add modules to empty panes
steps.actual: 'Add Existing Module' links available in all panes including empty areas, enabling content addition

steps.action: Accessed module Settings via Admin menu
steps.expected: Module settings dialog should open with visibility options
steps.actual: Module Settings dialog opened with tabs: Module Settings, Permissions, Page Settings, HTML Module Settings

steps.action: Navigated to Page Settings tab to view visibility options
steps.actual: Page Settings tab shows: Collapse/Expand (Maximized/Minimized/None), Display Container checkbox, Allow Print, Allow Syndicate, Module Container selection

observations: Code in View.ascx.cs ProcessModules() method handles module placement by iterating through tab modules and assigning them to panes based on PaneName property
LayoutPane.cs is a simple HtmlGenericControl (div) that provides pane container functionality with Skin reference
ContentLayoutController.cs manages layout operations including column sizes and layout templates
DNNEmptyPane and EditBarEmptyPane CSS classes are used to handle empty pane styling in edit mode
Move menu provides comprehensive options: positional moves (Top, Up, Down, Bottom), pane-to-pane moves, and cross-page moves
